Package org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.services

Class AbstractEventReaderService<Reader>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.services.AbstractService
      • org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.services.AbstractEventReaderService<Reader>
  • Type Parameters:
    Reader - the class for the user-defined reader of the given data-type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Engine
    public abstract class AbstractEventReaderService<Reader>
extends AbstractService
    An abstract reader service that reads events from the configured input file.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public EngineData configure​(EngineData input)
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Configures the engine with the given input data.

        This method can be executed concurrently in several threads.

        Parameters:
        input - the data to configure the engine with
        Returns:
        an (optional) result and/or status of the configuration request, it could be null or without output data (but not recommended)

      • createReader

        protected abstract Reader createReader​(java.nio.file.Path file,
                                       org.json.JSONObject opts)
                                throws EventReaderException
        Creates a new reader and opens the given input file.
        Parameters:
        file - the path to the input file
        opts - extra options for the reader
        Returns:
        a new reader ready to read events from the input file
        Throws:
        EventReaderException - if the reader could not be created

      • closeReader

        protected abstract void closeReader()
        Closes the reader and its input file.

      • execute

        public EngineData execute​(EngineData input)
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Executes the engine with the given input data.

        This method can be executed concurrently in several threads.

        Parameters:
        input - the data to execute the engine with
        Returns:
        the result and/or status of the execution request, it cannot be null or without data (unless it is an error status), and it should not be the same input data reference

      • executeGroup

        public EngineData executeGroup​(java.util.Set<EngineData> inputs)
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Executes the engine with the given set of input data.

        This method can be executed concurrently in several threads.

        Specified by:
        executeGroup in interface Engine
        Overrides:
        executeGroup in class AbstractService
        Parameters:
        inputs - the data set to execute the engine with
        Returns:
        the result and/or status of the execution request, it cannot be null or without data (unless it is an error status), and it should not be the same as one of the input data references

      • readEventCount

        protected abstract int readEventCount()
                               throws EventReaderException
        Gets the total number of events that can be read from the input file.
        Returns:
        the total number of events in the file
        Throws:
        EventReaderException - if the file could not be read

      • readByteOrder

        protected abstract java.nio.ByteOrder readByteOrder()
                                             throws EventReaderException
        Gets the byte order of the events stored in the input file.
        Returns:
        the byte order of the events in the file
        Throws:
        EventReaderException - if the file could not be read

      • readEvent

        protected abstract java.lang.Object readEvent​(int eventNumber)
                                       throws EventReaderException
        Reads an event from the input file. The event should be a Java object with the same type as the one defined by the ERSAP engine data-type returned by getDataType().
        Parameters:
        eventNumber - the index of the event in the file (starts from zero)
        Returns:
        the read event as a Java object
        Throws:
        EventReaderException - if the file could not be read

      • getDataType

        protected abstract EngineDataType getDataType()
        Gets the ERSAP engine data-type for the type of the events. The data-type will be used to serialize the events when the engine data result needs to be sent to services over the network.
        Returns:
        the data-type of the events

      • getInputDataTypes

        public java.util.Set<EngineDataType> getInputDataTypes()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Gets the set of input data types supported by the engine.
        Returns:
        the allowed input data types, it cannot be null nor empty

      • getOutputDataTypes

        public java.util.Set<EngineDataType> getOutputDataTypes()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Gets the set of output data types supported by the engine.
        Returns:
        the allowed output data types, it cannot be null nor empty

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Resets this engine to its initial setup. It should at least revert any changes done by configuration requests and side-effects of execute requests.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Destroy this engine, closing and cleaning up any opened resources.
